name: Ain't Got No Rhythm
description:
Rhythm game about doing mundane day-to-day tasks. 

Features:

Map editor for any custom song,

First crappy level,

Procrastination.

Controls:

Map editor:

  Song path is from the music folder in resources, so the path should be:   "Music/{songfilename}".

  If loading a level file to edit, the path should be "{songdatafilename}.song" (Only loads in the correct BPM and song file).

  Use the 1 - 4 keys to adjust the beet detail, so 2 would give you twice the amount of beats, and 4 would give you 8 times the amount (relative to 1).

  Use the dropdown box in the bottom right to add key events, they will show up in the song in the order you add them.

Creator's note:

  I obviously didn't finish this, due to procrastinating over having to do all of the music and art for the game. Maybe next time I'll make something possible for me! I hope you enjoy the idea regardless, and hey you can try out the map editor for fun! 

FAQ:

  What's that blank button in the level select screen? - I don't know and it scares me.

  How do I quit the game? - Oh, I've forgotten to add a way to exit again... Alt+f4.

  Aren't you just making these questions up because your game is shoddy? - Maybe...

  Why is everything slightly off? - Well, it wasn't until I built the game! Probably some wrong math in the code, sorry!
